text.0: to him adorable mighty meet for synods this strengthening hymn unceasing have they offered.
text.1: may agni hear us with his homely splendours hear us eternal one with heavenly lustre.
text.2: to mighty heaven and earth i sing forth loudly my wish goes out desirous and well knowing.
text.3: both at whose laud in synods showing favour the gods rejoice them with the living mortal.
text.4: o heaven and earth may your great law he faithful he ye our leaders for our high advantage.
text.5: to heaven and earth i offer this my homage with food o agni as i pray for riches.
text.6: yea holy heaven and earth the ancient sages whose word was ever true had power to find you.
text.7: and brave men in the fightwhere heroes conquer o earth have known you well and paid you honour.
text.8: what pathway leadeth to the gods who knoweth this of a truth and who will now declare it.
text.9: seen are their lowest dwellingplaces only but they are in remote and secret regions.
text.10: the sage who looketh on mankind hath viewed them bedewed rejoicing in the seat of order.
text.11: they make a home as for a bird though parted with one same will finding themselves together.
text.12: partners though parted with fardistant limits on one firm place both stand for ever watchful.
text.13: and being young for evermore as sisters speak to each other names that are united.
text.14: all living things they part and keep asunder though bearing up the mighty gods they reel not.
text.15: one all is lord of what is fixed and moving that walks that flies this multiform creation.
text.16: afar the ancient from of old i ponder our kinship with our mighty sire and father.
text.17: singing the praise whereof the gods by custom stand on the spacious farextended pathway.
text.18: this laud o heaven and earth to you i utter let the kindhearted hear whose tongue is agni.
text.19: young sovran rulers varuṇa and mitra the wise and very glorious Ādityas.
text.20: the fairtongued savitar the goldenhanded comes thrice from heaven as lord in our assembly.
text.21: bear to the gods this song of praise and send us then savitar complete and perfect safety.
text.22: deft worker skifulhanded helpful holy may tvaṣṭar god give us these things to aid us.
text.23: take your delight ye Ṛbhus joined with pūṣan ye have prepared the rite with stones adjusted.
text.24: borne on their flashing car the speararmed maruts the nimble youths of heaven the sons of order.
text.25: the holy and sarasvatī shall hear us ye mighty give us wealth with noble offspring.
text.26: to viṣṇu rich in marvels songs and praises shall go as singers on the road of bhaga.
text.27: the chieftain of the mighty stride whose mothers the many young dames never disregard him.
text.28: indra who rules through all his powers heroic hath with his majesty filled earth and heaven.
text.29: lord of brave hosts fortcrusher vṛtraslayer gather thou up and bring us store of cattle.
text.30: my sires are the nāsatyas kind tokinsmen the aśvins kinship is a glorious title.
text.31: for ye are they who give us store of riches ye guard your gift uncheated by the bounteous.
text.32: this is ye wise your great and glorious title that all ye deities abide in indra.
text.33: friend muchinvoked art thou with thy dear Ṛbhus fashion ye this our hymn for our advantage.
text.34: aryaman aditi deserve our worship the laws of varuṇa remain unbroken.
text.35: the lot of childlessness remove ye from us and let our course be rich in kine and offspring.
text.36: may the gods envoy sent to many a quarter proclaim us sinless for our perfect safety.
text.37: may earth and heaven the sun the waters hear us and the wide firmament and constellations.
text.38: hear us the mouatains which distil the raindrops and resting firm rejoice in freshening moisture.
text.39: may aditi with the Ādityas hear us and maruts grant us their auspicious shelter.
text.40: soft be our path for ever wellprovisioned with pleasant meath o gods the herbs besprinkle.
text.41: safe be my bliss o agni in thy friendship may i attain the seat of foodful riches.
text.42: enjoy the offering beam thou strength upon us combine thou for our good all kinds of glory.
text.43: conquer in battle agni all those foemen and light us every day with loving kindness.
